title: Atley the cub bear
subtitle: 2. Help when you can.
author: Barbara Lee
theme: Little animals' learning to treat others with kindness.

pages.story_text: Atley the cub bear was playing in the sunny forest when he saw a little bird sitting on a branch, looking sad.
pages.image_description: A small bird with a long tail sitting on a branch.

pages.story_text: Atley the cub bear was feeling really lonely. He missed his friends, who were all away on an adventure. He wandered through the sunny forest, looking for them.
pages.image_description: A lonely cub bear looking out into the forest.

pages.story_text: Atley the cub bear was a little different. While his friends, the cat Luna, the dog Leo, the rabbit Bella, and the bird Sunny, all had unique features, Atley had a soft, fuzzy coat the color of a summer cloud. He was always eager to help, even if he didn't always know how.
Atley the cub bear was feeling lonely. He had been alone all day, watching other animals play and laugh together. He longed to join them but was too shy to approach.
pages.image_description: Atley the cub bear sitting on a branch, looking down at the forest floor.

pages.story_text: Atley was a curious cub bear. He loved to explore the forest, searching for new things to discover. One sunny afternoon, while wandering through the forest, he stumbled upon a group of animals chatting and laughing together.
pages.image_description: A cub bear with a bright smile exploring a sunny forest.

pages.story_text: The colorful leaves danced in the warm sunlight as Atley the cub bear frolicked among the flowers in the sunny forest.
pages.image_description: Atley the cub bear is running around with a wide smile on his face, his fur shimmering with the sunlight.

pages.story_text: Atley was tired. He had been chasing butterflies all day, and he was starting to get hungry.
pages.image_description: Atley is curled up on a branch, looking tired and hungry.
